QuestionStatement: After graduating from high school, Maria chose to go to college, while Omar chose to work full time.  Which of the following best describes the opportunity costs for these decisions?
AnswerChoices: Maria’s opportunity cost includes the salary she could have earned if she had gone to work
Maria’s opportunity cost is her living expenses while attending college
Omar’s opportunity cost is the salary he will earn from working
Omar’s opportunity cost is the tuition and expenses he would have paid for college
Omar’s opportunity cost is definitely greater than Maria’s

QuestionStatement: The basic economic problem of all economies is essentially one of deciding how to make the best use of
AnswerChoices: Unlimited resources to satisfy unlimited wants
Limited resources to satisfy unlimited wants
Unlimited resources to satisfy limited wants
Limited resources to satisfy limited wants
Limited resources to provide public goods

AnswerChoices: BDC
P

P

QuestionStatement: 1.      If the government imposes a tariff on imports of cheese, the price and quantity of imported cheese will most likely change in which of the following ways?              Price            Quantitya.      Decrease            Decreaseb.      Decrease            Increasec.      Increase            Not changed.      Increase            Decreasee.      Increase            Increase
AnswerChoices: See above
See above
See above
See above
See above

QuestionStatement: According to the law of demand, an increase in the price of grape juice will result in
AnswerChoices: A rightward shift in the demand curve for grape juice
A leftward shift in the demand curve for grape juice
A decrease in the demand for orange juice, a substitute
A decrease in the quantity of grape juice demanded
An increase in the quantity of grape juice supplied

QuestionStatement: The table above shows the demand schedules for Jill and for all other consumers, as well as the market supply schedule for the same good.  The equilibrium price in this market is
Which of the following is true of the marginal cost curve?
AnswerChoices: It intersects the average variable cost curve and the average total cost curve at each curve’s minimum point
It intersects the average variable cost curve and the average fixed cost curve at each curve’s minimum point
It lies between the total cost curve and the total variable cost curve
It increases initially, for a time, but begins to decline when the point of diminishing marginal returns is reached
It decreases, because average variable cost is less than marginal cost

QuestionStatement: If the marginal cost of producing the first unit of some good is $20 and the marginal cost of producing the second unit is $30, the average variable cost of producing 2 units is
The use of game theory to explain strategic behavior among firms is most associated with which of the following market structures?
AnswerChoices: Perfect competition
Monopolistic competition
Oligopoly
Monopoly
Monopsony

QuestionStatement: All of the following are essential characteristics of a perfectly competitive industry EXCEPT
AnswerChoices: All of the products produced by the firms in the industry are homogeneous
All firms in the industry are price takers
All consumers and firms are completely aware of the prices at which transactions take place in the industry
There are barriers to entry into and exit from the industry
Price is equal to marginal revenue for every firm in the industry

QuestionStatement: The marginal revenue product of labor is the
AnswerChoices: Product price times the wage rate
Additional revenue a firm earns when it employs an additional unit of labor
Increase in the average product of labor when the firm employs an additional unit of labor
Increase in the price of labor when the firm employs an additional unit of labor
Marginal revenue plus product price

QuestionStatement: For a competitive labor market, an increase in which of the following will lead to an increase in the demand for labor?
AnswerChoices: The supply of labor
The minimum wage
The cost of medical benefits provided to the labor hired by firms
Labor union dues
The demand for the good that labor produces

QuestionStatement: Which of the following indicates that a perfectly competitive firm is in long-run equilibrium?
AnswerChoices: Price equals marginal cost
Price equals average revenue
Price equals marginal cost, which equals average total cost
Price equals average revenue, which equals marginal revenue
Price equals average fixed cost

QuestionStatement: Which of the following best represents a positive externality?
AnswerChoices: Purchasing a pass for an amusement park
Dining at a favorite restaurant
Being disturbed by neighboring construction noise
Enjoying watching birds at a neighbor’s bird feeder
Dumping waste on someone else’s property

QuestionStatement: Which of the following is a characteristic of a public good?
AnswerChoices: It is excludable
It is nonrival in consumption
It yields substantial spillover costs
The private sector would produce a larger than socially optimal quantity
Private-sector producers would realize too great a profit

QuestionStatement: If a perfectly competitive firm is producing where marginal cost is rising and greater than marginal revenue, to maximize profits it should
AnswerChoices: Increase the level of production
Decrease the level of production
Maintain current levels of production
Increase price
Decrease price

QuestionStatement: If cotton is used to produce towels, an increase in the price of cotton will result in which of the following changes in the towel market?
AnswerChoices: A decrease in the demand for towels, which leads to a shortage of towels followed by upward pressure on the price of towels
A decrease in the demand for towels, which leads to a surplus of towels followed by downward pressure on the price of towels
A decrease in the supply of towels, which leads to a shortage of towels followed by upward pressure on the price of towels
An increase in the supply of towels, which leads to a surplus of towels followed by downward pressure on the price of towels
An increase in both the demand and supply of towels, which leads to a surplus of towels followed by upward pressure on the price of towels

QuestionStatement: Assume that an economy produces televisions and shoes.  Which of the following would cause the production possibilities curve for this economy to shift outward?
AnswerChoices: An increase in the labor force
An increase in the prices of both goods
An increase in the prices of resources used to produce both goods
A decrease in the demand for shoes
A change in consumers’ tastes in favor of televisions

QuestionStatement: Jane spends all her weekly allowances to buy only two goods: soda and apples.  According to the table above, if her preferences are characterized by the law of diminishing marginal utility, then which of the following statements is correct?
AnswerChoices: Jane is maximizing her utility
Jane can buy more apples and less soda to maximize her utility
Jane can buy more soda and fewer apples to maximize her utility
Jane can buy more apples and the same amount of soda to maximize her utility
Jane can buy more soda and the same amount of apples to maximize her utility

QuestionStatement: If a firm is experiencing economies of scale, which of the following will decrease as output increases?
AnswerChoices: Fixed costs
Long-run total cost
Long-run average total cost
Marginal cost
Marginal revenue
